title: An Ordinance to consolidate and amend the law relating to marriages other than the marriages of Muslims and to provide for the better registration thereof.

sections.title: Short title
sections.text: This Ordinance may be cited as the Marriage Registration Ordinance.

sections.title: Appointment of Registrar-General and his duties
sections.text: There may be appointed a Registrar-General of Marriages for Sri Lanka. The Registrar-General shall, subject to the directions of the Minister, have the general control and superintendence of the registration of marriages under the provisions of this Ordinance...

sections.title: Appointment of Deputy Registrar-General and his duties
sections.text: There may be appointed a fit and proper person to be or to act as a Deputy Registrar-General of Marriages.

sections.title: District Registrars
sections.text: For each district there shall be a District Registrar of Marriages. The Government Agent of a district shall be the District Registrar for that district.

sections.title: Establishment of registration divisions
sections.text: The Minister may, by Notification in the Gazette, divide the several districts of Sri Lanka into such and so many divisions for the purpose of the registration of marriages as shall appear expedient...

sections.title: Appointment of registrars
sections.text: The Registrar-General may appoint one or more persons to each such division, who shall be called Registrars of Marriages...

sections.title: Power to make rules
sections.text: The Minister may from time to time make rules for the direction of the Registrar-General, the District Registrars, registrars, ministers, and all persons whomsoever in the discharge of their duties under this Ordinance...

sections.title: Residence, office, and station of registrar
sections.text: Every registrar shall dwell and have his office in such convenient place in his division as shall be appointed by the District Registrar...

sections.title: Attendance of registrar at his office
sections.text: The registrar shall attend at his office and at each such station on such days and during such hours as shall respectively be appointed by the District Registrar...

sections.title: Registration of place of solemnization of marriage
sections.text: The minister, proprietor, or trustee of a building used as a place of worship for public Christian worship may apply to the Registrar-General that such building may be registered for solemnizing marriages therein.

sections.title: Registration of such place in thinly populated district
sections.text: Where the population in any district is so scattered that it is difficult to procure the signatures of twenty householders, it shall be lawful for the Registrar-General to issue his certificate upon a declaration signed by as many householders as live within convenient distance...

sections.title: Cancellation or substitution of building
sections.text: If any building registered for the solemnization of marriages shall at any subsequent period cease to be used for the public Christian worship..., the minister, proprietor, or trustee... shall notify the fact to the Registrar-General...

sections.title: Rectification of errors
sections.text: The Registrar-General may at any time correct or cause to be corrected any error in any entry made in the book kept under section 10 for the registration of buildings.

sections.title: Publication of lists of registrars and registered buildings
sections.text: The Registrar-General may from time to time publish in the Gazette a list of the Registrars of Marriages in Sri Lanka..., and a list of the buildings registered for the solemnization of marriages therein...

sections.title: Prohibited age of marriage
sections.text: No marriage shall be valid, the male party to which has not completed sixteen years of age or the female twelve, or if a daughter of European or Burgher parents, fourteen years of age.

sections.title: Prohibited degrees of relationship
sections.text: No marriage shall be valid— (a) where either party shall be directly descended from the other; or (b) where the female shall be sister of the male...; or (c) where the male shall be brother of the female...

sections.title: Marriage of persons within prohibited degrees of relationship an offence
sections.text: Any marriage or cohabitation between parties standing towards each other in any of the above-enumerated degrees of relationship shall be deemed to be an offence, and shall be punishable with imprisonment...

sections.title: Second marriage without legal dissolution of first marriage invalid
sections.text: No marriage shall be valid where either of the parties thereto shall have contracted a prior marriage which shall not have been legally dissolved or declared void.

sections.title: Dissolution of marriage
sections.text: No marriage shall be dissolved during the lifetime of the parties except by judgment of divorce a vinculo matrimonii pronounced in some competent court...

sections.title: Suits to compel marriage prohibited
sections.text: No suit or action shall lie in any court to compel the solemnization of any marriage by reason of any promise or contract of marriage, or by reason of the seduction of any female, or by reason of any cause whatsoever.

sections.title: Who may give consent to marriage of a minor
sections.text: The father of any person under twenty-one years of age; or if the father be dead..., the mother; or if both father and mother be dead..., the guardian... shall have authority to give consent to the marriage of such party...

sections.title: Preliminaries to be observed prior to a marriage
sections.text: In every case of marriage intended to be solemnized under the provisions of this Ordinance, the following preliminaries shall be observed...

sections.title: Form of notice and declaration
sections.text: The notice... shall be in the form D..., and shall state— (a) the name in full..., (b) the name... of the father of each such party.

sections.title: Publication of notice
sections.text: Every registrar... shall cause a true copy... to be posted in some conspicuous place in his office during twelve successive days after the entry of such notice.

sections.title: Issue of certificate
sections.text: At any time not less than twelve days..., nor more than three months... from the entry of the notice, the registrar... shall... issue a certificate...

sections.title: Issue of certificate by licence
sections.text: At any time after the entry of the notice..., the District Registrar... may issue... a licence... authorizing... the issue of the certificate.

sections.title: Issue of certificates and solemnization of marriages upon alteration of divisions
sections.text: Where, by virtue of any Notification under section 5, any area... becomes... a separate division..., and where, before that date, notice of an intended marriage is given..., that certificate may be issued, or that marriage may be solemnized...

sections.title: Forbidding of issue of certificate
sections.text: Every person whose consent to a marriage is required by law may forbid the issue of the registrar's certificate by signing... a notice in writing...

sections.title: Caveat
sections.text: Any person may at any time before the issue of the certificate enter a caveat against its issue. Such caveat shall... contain... the grounds on which he objects to the marriage...

sections.title: Proceedings on marriage being forbidden or caveat entered
sections.text: In the event of a marriage being forbidden or of a caveat being entered..., the registrar shall refuse to issue the certificate, and shall... make report... to the Judge of the Family Court...

sections.title: Where may marriage be solemnized
sections.text: On the production of the certificate..., it shall be lawful for a marriage to be solemnized... (a) by or in the presence of the minister... or (b) by the registrar in his office...

sections.title: Solemnization of marriage by minister
sections.text: A marriage in a registered place of worship shall be solemnized by or in the presence of the minister... between six o'clock in the morning and six o'clock in the afternoon in the presence of two or more credible witnesses...

sections.title: Solemnization of marriage by registrar
sections.text: A marriage in the presence of the registrar shall... be solemnized... with open doors, and between the hours of six o'clock in the morning and six o'clock in the afternoon... The registrar shall address the parties...

sections.title: Copy of registration entry to be issued free
sections.text: The third copy... shall forthwith, free of charge, be delivered or transmitted by post to the female party to the marriage...

sections.title: Addition of religious ceremony to marriage solemnized by registrar
sections.text: Where a minister... reads or celebrates... any marriage service... at the request of the parties to any marriage which has previously been solemnized by a registrar, such reading or celebration shall not... supersede or to affect in any way the marriage previously solemnized...

sections.title: Transmission to Registrar-General of duplicates of entries, substitution of original and duplicate entries, and reconstruction of original and duplicate entries
sections.text: The duplicates of entries made by the registrar under section 35 shall be separated from the book by him and sent monthly to the District Registrar...

sections.title: Solemnization of marriage by minister or registrar under special licence
sections.text: In case the female party to an intended marriage belongs to a class of people to whose customs it is contrary to require their females to appear in public before wedlock, it shall be lawful for the District Registrar... to issue a licence empowering a registrar to solemnize the marriage at such place and hour as the parties may prefer...

sections.title: New notice required after three months
sections.text: Whenever a marriage shall not be... had within three months... after the notice thereof shall have been entered..., the notice... and all other proceedings thereupon, shall be utterly void...

sections.title: Death-bed marriage
sections.text: It shall be competent for a minister to solemnize without the preliminaries... a marriage between parties of whom one is believed to be on the point of death: Provided that such person is of sound mind, memory, and understanding.

sections.title: Entry made by registrar in marriage register the best evidence of marriage
sections.text: The entry made by the registrar in his marriage register book... shall constitute the registration of the marriage, and shall be the best evidence thereof...

sections.title: Proof of certain matters not necessary to validity of registered marriage
sections.text: After any marriage shall have been registered... it shall not be necessary... to give any proof of the actual dwelling... or of the consent... or that the place or hour of marriage was... prescribed...

sections.title: Mode of supplying omission and correcting error in registration
sections.text: Where a marriage... may have been omitted to be registered, or may have been erroneously registered..., either of the said parties... may apply to the Family Court... to have such marriage duly registered...

sections.title: Correction of clerical errors in registers
sections.text: Any clerical error which may from time to time be discovered in a marriage register may, after due inquiry, be corrected by any person authorized in that behalf by the Registrar-General...

sections.title: Penalty on making false declaration or giving false notice
sections.text: Any person who shall knowingly or wilfully make any false declaration or sign any false notice required by this Ordinance for the purpose of procuring the registration of any marriage... shall be guilty of the offence of giving false evidence...

sections.title: Circumstances in which a marriage will be null and void
sections.text: If both the parties... shall knowingly and wilfully intermarry... in any place other than that prescribed..., or under a false name..., or... without certificate..., or shall... consent to... solemnization by a person who is not authorized..., the marriage... shall be null and void.

sections.title: Solemnization of marriage by means of a false document
sections.text: If any valid marriage shall be had... by means of any wilfully false notice, certificate, or declaration..., it shall be competent for the proper Family Court to inquire therein...

sections.title: Settlements and agreements in regard to such marriage void
sections.text: All agreements, settlements, and deeds entered into or executed by the parties to any such marriage... shall be absolutely void, and have no force or effect so far as the same shall be inconsistent with the provisions of the security and settlement made by the court...

sections.title: Books to be kept by the Registrar-General, District Registrar, &c.
sections.text: The Registrar-General, District Registrars, registrars, and ministers, shall keep books for the purposes of this Ordinance, in such form as is prescribed...

sections.title: Forms
sections.text: The forms in the First Schedule... shall be used in all cases in which they are applicable, and when so used shall be valid in law.

sections.title: Search of registers and issue of certified copies or extracts
sections.text: Any person shall be entitled... to refer to any book or document... and to demand... a certified copy of or extract from every entry...

sections.title: Third copy, certified copy or extract to be prima facie evidence
sections.text: Such copy or extract... shall be received as prima facie evidence of the matter to which it relates, without any further or other proof of such entry.

sections.title: Surrender of records on registrar ceasing to hold office
sections.text: In every case in which a registrar shall cease to hold office, all the books, documents, papers... shall be delivered by him... to the District Registrar...

sections.title: Destruction of documents
sections.text: Any District Registrar may cause any of the following documents... to be destroyed after a period of ten years from the date on which the document was received by him.

sections.title: Penalty for non-delivery
sections.text: If any person... shall fail, neglect, or refuse to deliver them to the District Registrar, he shall be guilty of an offence...

sections.title: Penalty for losing or injuring a document
sections.text: Every person having the custody of any book or document... who shall carelessly lose or injure the same... shall be guilty of an offence...

sections.title: Penalty for destruction of documents and for giving false certificates
sections.text: Every person who... shall knowingly and wilfully tear, deface, destroy, or injure any notice, certificate, declaration, book, or any document... shall be guilty of an offence...

sections.title: Penalty for omission to register
sections.text: Every registrar who without reasonable cause refuses or omits to register a marriage... shall be liable to a fine...

sections.title: Offences by minister
sections.text: Any minister— (a) by or before whom... shall be solemnized a marriage before the delivery to him of the certificate...; or (b) who shall fail to enter duly in the marriage register... shall be guilty of an offence...

sections.title: Undue solemnization of marriage and issue of certificate
sections.text: Any person who shall knowingly and wilfully solemnize or pretend to solemnize a marriage not being legally competent to do so... shall be guilty of an offence...

sections.title: Notices, informations, declarations, certificates, &c., how transmitted
sections.text: All notices, informations, declarations, certificates... may be sent by post... and the date at which they would be delivered... shall be deemed to be the date at which they were received...

sections.title: Fees payable
sections.text: Subject to the provisions of section 34, the fees enumerated in the Second Schedule shall be payable by and to the persons therein mentioned and for the duties therein specified.

sections.title: Proceedings in courts to be exempt from stamp duty
sections.text: All proceedings in a Court of Justice under this Ordinance shall be exempt from stamp duty unless otherwise specially provided.

sections.title: Interpretation
sections.text: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires— "district" means administrative district; "District Registrar"... includes an Additional District Registrar; "marriage" means any marriage, save and except marriages contracted under... the Kandyan Marriage and Divorce Act, and except marriages contracted between persons professing Islam; "minister" means any person ordained...; "prescribed" means prescribed by rule made under section 7. "Registrar-General" includes a Deputy Registrar-General.

title: An Act to amend and consolidate the law relating to Kandyan marriages and divorces, and to make provision for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.

sections.title: Short title
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Kandyan Marriage and Divorce Act.

sections.title: Application of Act
sections.text: The provisions of this Act shall not, unless otherwise expressly provided therein, apply to marriages contracted before the appointed date.

sections.title: Marriages between persons subject to Kandyan law
sections.text: Subject to the provisions of this Act— (a) a marriage, between persons subject to Kandyan law, shall be solemnized and registered under this Act or under the Marriage Registration Ordinance; and (b) any such marriage which is not so solemnized and registered shall be invalid.

sections.title: Lawful age of marriage
sections.text: No Kandyan marriage shall be valid if, at the time of marriage— (a) either party thereto is under the lawful age of marriage; or (b) both parties thereto are under the lawful age of marriage.

sections.title: Prohibited degrees of relationship
sections.text: No Kandyan marriage shall be valid— (a) if either party thereto is directly descended from the other; or (b) if the female party thereto is the sister of the male party thereto...; or (c) if the male party thereto is the brother of the female party thereto...

sections.title: Second marriage without legal dissolution of first marriage invalid
sections.text: No Kandyan marriage shall be valid— (a) if one party thereto has contracted a prior marriage; and (b) if the other party to such prior marriage is still living, unless such prior marriage has been lawfully dissolved or declared void.

sections.title: Legitimization of illegitimate children
sections.text: A valid Kandyan marriage shall render legitimate any children who may have been procreated by the parties thereto previous to such marriage...

sections.title: Consent required to marriage of minor

sections.title: Notice of prospective Kandyan marriage
sections.text: Every prospective Kandyan marriage shall be notified to the appropriate Registrar... shall state— (i) the name in full... age... civil condition... (ii) the nature of the marriage (whether in binna or diga); and (iii) the length of residence...

sections.title: Issue of certificates in respect of Kandyan marriages
sections.text: The declaration shall be accompanied by a receipt issued by the District Registrar in proof of payment of the prescribed fee.

sections.title: Objections to issue of marriage notice certificates
sections.text: Any person, being a person who is interested in a Kandyan marriage may object in writing, to the issue of a marriage notice certificate in respect thereof.

sections.title: Solemnization of Kandyan marriages
sections.text: A Registrar... shall... solemnize the marriage... upon the production... of the marriage notice certificate...

sections.title: Registration of Kandyan marriages
sections.text: Immediately after the solemnization... the Registrar shall register accurately... the name..., age..., civil condition..., occupation..., residence..., and nature of marriage (binna/diga)...

sections.title: Issue of copy of marriage registration entry free
sections.text: The third copy... shall forthwith, free of charge, be delivered or transmitted by post to the female party...

sections.title: Registration to constitute best evidence of marriage
sections.text: The registration... shall be the best evidence of the marriage... If binna/diga not stated, marriage presumed diga.

sections.title: Proof of certain matters not required once Kandyan marriage is registered
sections.text: After... registration... it shall not be necessary... to prove... residence..., consent..., or place/hour of solemnization.

sections.title: Grounds for divorce
sections.text: The dissolution of a Kandyan marriage shall be granted on any of the following grounds:— (a) Adultery by the wife... (b) Adultery by the husband... (c) Complete and continued desertion... (d)... (e) Inability to live happily together... (f) Mutual consent.

sections.title: Appointment of Registrars of Kandyan Marriages
sections.text: A person shall be disqualified from being appointed or continuing as a Registrar, if he... (e) is engaged in a profession that would prejudicially affect the duties of a Registrar.

sections.title: False declarations, &c.
sections.text: Any person who, for the purpose of procuring the solemnization or registration of a Kandyan marriage knowingly or wilfully makes and subscribes any false declaration... shall be guilty of an offence under this Act.

sections.title: Interpretation
sections.text: "lawful age of marriage" in relation to the male party and the female party to the marriage means eighteen years of age.

title: An Act to make provision with respect to the marriages and divorces of Muslims in Sri Lanka and, in particular, with respect to the registration of such marriages and divorces.

sections.title: Short title
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Muslim Marriage and Divorce Act.

sections.title: Application of Act
sections.text: This Act shall apply only to the marriages and divorces, and other matters connected therewith, of those inhabitants of Sri Lanka who are Muslims.

sections.title: Registrars of Muslim Marriages
sections.text: The Registrar-General may... appoint as a Registrar of Muslim Marriages any male Muslim who... is a fit and proper person...

sections.title: Quazis
sections.text: The Judicial Service Commission may appoint any male Muslim of good character... to be a Quazi.

sections.title: Board of Quazis
sections.text: The Judicial Service Commission may appoint a Board of Quazis... to hear appeals from the decisions of the Quazis under this Act.

sections.title: Validity or invalidity of Muslim marriages
sections.text: Nothing contained in this Act shall be construed to render valid or invalid, by reason only of registration or non-registration, any Muslim marriage or divorce which is otherwise invalid or valid, as the case may be, according to the Muslim law governing the sect to which the parties to such marriage or divorce belong.

sections.title: Duty of causing marriage to be registered
sections.text: Save as otherwise hereinafter expressly provided, every marriage contracted between Muslims after the commencement of this Act shall be registered... immediately upon the conclusion of the Nikah ceremony...

sections.title: Declaration and form of registration
sections.text: The prescribed fee shall be paid by the bridegroom.

sections.title: Issue of copy of registration entry free
sections.text: The third copy... shall forthwith, free of charge, be delivered or transmitted by post to the female party to the marriage by the registrar.

sections.title: Marriage of girl who has not attained the age of twelve not to be registered without Quazi's permission
sections.text: Notwithstanding anything in section 17, a marriage contracted by a Muslim girl who has not attained the age of twelve years shall not be registered under this Act unless the Quazi... has... authorized the registration of the marriage.

sections.title: Second or subsequent marriages
sections.text: Where a married male Muslim... intends to contract another marriage, he shall, at least thirty days before contracting such other marriage, give notice of his intention to the Quazi...

sections.title: Declaration of Shafi’i law as to marriage of women of that sect
sections.text: No contract of marriage of a woman belonging to the Shaffie sect is valid under the law applicable to that sect, unless— (a) a person entitled to act as her wali— (i) is present...; and (ii) communicates her consent...; or (b) the Quazi has... dispensed with the necessity for the presence and the approval of a wali.

sections.title: Divorce by husband
sections.text: Where a husband desires to divorce his wife the procedure laid down in the Second Schedule shall be followed.

sections.title: Divorce by wife
sections.text: Where a wife desires to effect a divorce from her husband, without his consent, on the ground of ill-treatment or on account of any act or omission on his part which amounts to a "fault" under the Muslim law governing the sect to which the parties belong, the procedure laid down in the Third Schedule shall be followed.

sections.title: Registration of divorces in cases where proof of divorce is inadequate
sections.text: Where... a Muslim husband states that he has... divorced his wife, but is unable to prove that a divorce was in fact effected, the statement... shall be deemed to be the pronouncement of a talak... and shall be recorded accordingly...

sections.title: General powers of Quazis
sections.text: The powers of the Quazi under this Act shall include the power to inquire into and adjudicate upon— (a) mahr; (b) wife's maintenance; (c) child's maintenance; (cc) maintenance for illegitimate child; (d) divorced wife's maintenance; (f) kaikuli; (h) mediation; (i) nullity; (j) authority to register marriage of girl <12.

sections.title: Quazi to have exclusive jurisdiction
sections.text: Subject to any special provision... the jurisdiction exercisable by a Quazi under section 47 shall be exclusive and any matter falling within that jurisdiction shall not be tried or inquired into by any other court or tribunal whatsoever.

sections.title: Representation of parties and witnesses before Quazis
sections.text: No attorney-at-law shall be entitled or permitted to appear on behalf of any party or witness in any proceedings before a Quazi under this Act.

sections.title: Regulations
sections.text: The Minister may make regulations for or in respect of... (h) the fee (not stamp fee) to be paid on certified copies of or extract from any entry in a register relating to a marriage or divorce and on declarations under section 18(1);...

sections.title: Interpretation
sections.text: "kaikuli" means any sum of money paid, or other movable property given... to a bridegroom for the use of the bride... "Quazi" means a Quazi appointed under section 12... "registrar" means a male Muslim appointed under section 8...

title: An Ordinance to amend the law relating to the matrimonial rights of the Tamils who are now governed by the 'Tesawalamai' with regard to property and law of inheritance.

sections.title: Short title
sections.text: This Ordinance may be cited as the Jaffna Matrimonial Rights and Inheritance Ordinance.

sections.title: Application of Ordinance
sections.text: This Ordinance shall apply only to those Tamils to whom the Tesawalamai applies, and it shall apply in respect of their movable and immovable property wherever situate.

sections.title: Applicability of Tesawalamai to married women
sections.text: (1) Whenever a woman to whom the Tesawalamai applies marries a man to whom the Tesawalamai does not apply, she shall not during the subsistence of the marriage be subject to the Tesawalamai. (2) Whenever a woman to whom the Tesawalamai does not apply marries a man to whom the Tesawalamai applies, she shall during the subsistence of the marriage be subject to the Tesawalamai.

sections.title: Matrimonial rights of spouses married before the Ordinance
sections.text: The respective matrimonial rights of any husband and wife with regard to property or status arising under or by virtue of any marriage solemnized before the commencement of this Ordinance... shall be governed by such law as would have been applicable thereto if this Ordinance had not been passed.

sections.title: Matrimonial rights of those married after the Ordinance to be governed by the Ordinance
sections.text: The respective matrimonial rights of every husband and wife married after the commencement of this Ordinance in, to, or in respect of movable or immovable property shall, during the subsistence of such marriage, be governed by the provisions of this Ordinance.

sections.title: Property of a wife acquired during or before marriage to remain her separate property
sections.text: All movable or immovable property to which any woman married after the commencement of this Ordinance may be entitled... shall... belong to the woman for her separate estate... She may dispose of movables without husband’s consent; immovables require written consent.

sections.title: Property of husband acquired before or after marriage to be his separate property
sections.text: All movable or immovable property to which any husband married after the commencement of this Ordinance may be entitled... shall... belong to the husband for his separate estate. Such husband shall... have full power of disposing of and dealing with such property.

sections.title: Power to District Court to supply consent in certain cases
sections.text: If... the husband’s consent is unreasonably withheld... it shall be lawful for the wife to apply... to the District Court... for an order authorizing her to dispose of or deal with such property without her husband's consent.

sections.title: Power of husband or wife to make gifts to each other
sections.text: It shall be lawful for any husband or wife... to make or join each other in making during the marriage any voluntary grant, gift, or settlement of any property... but... all property so granted... shall be subject to the debts and engagements of each spouse.

sections.title: Power of District Court to settle dispute between husband and wife
sections.text: If any question or dispute shall arise between any husband and wife... relative to any property declared by this Ordinance to be the separate property of the wife, either party may apply... to the District Court... and thereupon the District Judge may make such order... as he shall think fit.

sections.title: Power to husband or wife to effect policy of insurance upon his or her life
sections.text: A husband or wife... may... effect a policy of insurance upon his or her own life... for his or her separate use; and the same... shall enure accordingly.

sections.title: Effect of life insurance by husband in favour of wife or children
sections.text: A policy of insurance... by any married man... on his own life and expressed... for the benefit of his wife or of his wife and children... shall enure and may be deemed a trust for the benefit of his wife for her separate use...

sections.title: Married woman having separate property to be liable to maintain her children
sections.text: A married woman having separate property adequate for the purpose shall be subject to all such liability for the maintenance of her children as a widow is now by law subject to... Provided that nothing in this Ordinance shall relieve her husband from any liability... to maintain her children.

sections.title: Applicability of sections of this Part of the Ordinance
sections.text: The following sections of this Ordinance shall apply to the estate of such persons only as shall die after the commencement of this Ordinance, and shall be then unmarried, or if married, shall have been married after the commencement of this Ordinance.

sections.title: Mudusam or property devolving on death of ancestor
sections.text: Property devolving on a person by descent at the death of his or her parent or of any other ancestor in the ascending line is called mudusam (patrimonial inheritance).

sections.title: Urumai or property devolving on death of relative
sections.text: Property devolving on a person by descent at the death of a relative other than a parent or an ancestor in the ascending line is called urumai (non-patrimonial inheritance).

sections.title: Property derived from the father's side
sections.text: Property received by any person in mudusam, or in urumai, or in dowry... from a father, or any of his ascendants, or any of his collateral relations, is said to be property derived from the father's side.

sections.title: Property derived from the mother's side
sections.text: Property received in mudusam, or in urumai, or in dowry... from a mother, or any of her ascendants, or any of her collateral relations, is said to be property derived from the mother's side.

sections.title: Meaning of thediatheddam
sections.text: No property other than the following shall be deemed to be the thediatheddam of a spouse:— (a) Property acquired by that spouse during the subsistence of the marriage for valuable consideration... (b) Profits arising during the subsistence of the marriage from the separate estate of that spouse.

sections.title: Devolution of thediatheddam
sections.text: On the death of either spouse one-half of the thediatheddam which belonged to the deceased spouse... shall devolve on the surviving spouse and the other half shall devolve on the heirs of the deceased spouse.

sections.title: Inheritance generally
sections.text: Subject to the right of the surviving spouse... the right of inheritance is divided in the following order as respects— (a) descendants, (b) ascendants, (c) collaterals.

sections.title: Rights of children, grand-children, and remoter descendants
sections.text: Children, grandchildren, and remoter descendants are preferent to all others in the estate of the parents. All the children take equally per capita; but the children or remoter issue of a deceased child take per stirpes.

sections.title: Heir in default of children
sections.text: The children and remoter descendants failing, the whole of the property the deceased derived from the father's side and one-half of the remainder of the estate of the deceased... the father, if surviving, shall inherit.

sections.title: Mother's right where children fail
sections.text: The whole of the property the deceased derived from the mother's side and one-half of the remainder of the estate of the deceased... the mother, if surviving, shall inherit.

sections.title: Rights of brothers and sisters where father has pre-deceased intestate
sections.text: Father failing, the property of the intestate derived from the father's side and one-half of the remainder of the intestate's estate... shall devolve upon the intestate's full brothers and sisters as well as upon half-brothers and half-sisters related to the intestate by the side of the father...

sections.title: Rights where mother has predeceased intestate
sections.text: Mother failing, the property of the intestate derived from the mother's side and one-half of the remainder of the intestate's estate... shall devolve upon the intestate's full brothers and sisters as well as on half-brothers and half-sisters related to the intestate by the side of the mother...

sections.title: Rights of paternal grandparents, paternal uncles and aunts, and great-grandparents
sections.text: All the persons above enumerated failing, the property derived by the intestate from the father's side and one-half of the remainder of the intestate's estate... shall devolve on the paternal grand-parent or grandparents of the intestate, if surviving; and failing them, on paternal uncles and aunts...

sections.title: Rights of maternal grandparents, maternal uncles and aunts, and maternal great-grandparents
sections.text: The property derived from the mother's side and one-half of the remainder of the intestate's estate... shall devolve on the maternal grandparent or grandparents, if surviving; and failing them, on maternal uncles and aunts...

sections.title: How estate is divided where those who inherit are equally near in degree to intestate
sections.text: Except when otherwise expressly provided, if all those who succeeded to the inheritance are equally near in degree to the intestate, they take per capita and not per stirpes.

sections.title: How property is divided on failure of kindred on the side of either parent
sections.text: (1) On failure of kindred on the father's side, property derived from that side shall devolve on the mother and her kindred... (2) On failure of kindred on the mother's side, property derived from that side shall devolve on the father and his kindred...

sections.title: When whole inheritance goes to the surviving spouse
sections.text: All the persons above enumerated failing, the entire inheritance goes to the surviving spouse, if any.

sections.title: When estate escheats to the State
sections.text: If anyone dies intestate without heirs, his or her estate escheats to the State. If, however, any heirs can be found, even beyond the tenth degree, they take the inheritance.

sections.title: Collation of property by children or grand-children
sections.text: Children or grandchildren... becoming with their brothers and sisters heirs to the deceased parents... are bound to bring into hotchpot... all that they have received from their deceased parents above the others by way of dowry or otherwise... unless it can be proved that the deceased parent... released any property so given from collation.

sections.title: Rights of illegitimate children
sections.text: Illegitimate children shall inherit the property of their intestate mother, but not that of their father.

sections.title: Devolution of property of illegitimate children
sections.text: When an illegitimate person leaves no surviving spouse or descendants, his or her property will go to the mother, and then to the heirs of the mother so as to exclude the State.

sections.title: Cases not provided for by this Ordinance
sections.text: In all questions relating to the distribution of the property of an intestate where this Ordinance is silent, the provisions of the Matrimonial Rights and Inheritance Ordinance, and such laws as apply to the Tamil inhabitants of the Western Province, shall apply.

sections.title: Interest of surviving spouse in estate devolving on minor child
sections.text: When the estate of a deceased parent devolves on a minor child, the surviving parent may continue to possess the same and enjoy the income thereof until such child is married or attains majority.

sections.title: Liability of surviving spouse to maintain minor child
sections.text: A surviving spouse continuing in possession of the estate of the deceased spouse as stated in the last section shall be bound to maintain the children till they attain majority either by effluxion of time or by marriage.

sections.title: Interpretation
sections.text: In this Ordinance, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context— "immovable property" includes land...; "movable property" means property of every description except immovable property; "matrimonial rights" means the respective rights and powers of married parties in or about the management... of property...; "unmarried" means not having a husband or wife living.
